Buddhist monks introduced tea ceremony t: Who introduced the tea ceremony to Japan? History of tea ceremony in Japan

The origins of this celebration can be traced back to the 9th-century CE. The first record found in historical text tells of how a Buddhist monk named Eichu, served tea to the ruler of Japan, Emperor Saga. This fateful meeting occurred on Emperor Saga's visit to the village of Karasaki, in the year 815 CE.
